forecaster.scenario module¶

Basic economic classes, such as Scenario and Money.

class forecaster.scenario.InflationAdjust(scenario)[source]¶

Bases: object

Callable inflation_adjust object with mutable state.

__call__(target_year, base_year=None)[source]¶

Inflation-adjustment factor from base_year to target_year.

Parameters:
  • target_year (int) – The year for which an inflation-adjustment factor is desired.
  • base_year (int) – The year in which inflation-adjusted figures are expressed. The inflation adjustment for this year is 1.
Returns:

The inflation-adjustment factor from base_year to target_year. This is the product of inflation-adjustments for each year (or its inverse, if target_year precedes base_year).
Return type:

Decimal
class forecaster.scenario.Scenario(initial_year, num_years, inflation=0, stock_return=0, bond_return=0, other_return=0, management_fees=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Describes an economic scenario over the course of the simulation.

For example, provides inflation rates and rates of return for each year of the simulation. This is the foil to Strategy; all Scenario information is reflective of broader economic trends and is independent of any user action.

inflation¶

dict – A dict of {year, inflation} pairs where the year is an int and inflation is a Decimal.

stock_return¶

dict – A dict of {int, Decimal} pairs where the key is the year and the Decimal is the rate of return for stocks.

bond_return¶

dict – A dict of {int, Decimal} pairs where the key is the year and the Decimal is the rate of return for bonds.

other_return¶

dict – A dict of {int, Decimal} pairs where the key is the year and the Decimal is the rate of return for stocks. Optional.

management_fees¶

dict – A dict of {int, Decimal} pairs where the key is the year and the Decimal is the management fees on investments. Optional.

initial_year¶

int – The first year of the simulation. Optional.

__iter__()[source]¶

Iterates over years modelled by the Scenario.

Yields:int – Each year modelled by the Scenario, in ascending order.
__len__()[source]¶

The number of years modelled by the Scenario.

accumulation_function(year1, year2)[source]¶

Returns the discount to be applied over the period from year1 to year2. If year1 > year2 then the discount rate is inverted.

discount_rate(year)[source]¶

Returns the discount rate for year. This is the same as calling inflation(year)

inflation_adjust¶

Inflation-adjustment factor from base_year to target_year.

Parameters:
  • target_year (int) – The year for which an inflation-adjustment factor is desired.
  • base_year (int) – The year in which inflation-adjusted figures are expressed. The inflation adjustment for this year is 1.
Returns:

The inflation-adjustment factor from base_year to target_year. This is the product of inflation-adjustments for each year (or its inverse, if target_year precedes base_year).
Return type:

Decimal
inflation_adjustments(base_year)[source]¶

Annual inflation adjustment factors relative to base_year.

Returns:{year: adjustment} pairs. adjustment is the cumulative inflation since base_year (or, for years prior to base_year, it is the present value of $1 in base_year)
Return type:dict[int, Decimal]
